analyzed: dus ma yin par bya ba byed pa dang // brtag pa @331b med pa'o //

analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa la rjes su zhugs pa'i chos ni gnyis te /

analyzed: ral gri dang / me long la sogs pa la 'bebs par byed do //

analyzed: na ma stree ya dhvi k'a n'am/

original: 'dis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsngags pa rgya mtsho rab 'byams rnams sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces bsams la /
analyzed: 'dis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsngags pa rgya mtsho rab 'byams rnams sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces bsams la /
translated: By this, through the blessing of all the Tathagatas, may the oceans of the praises of all the Tathagatas arise by the power of my aspiration in all the circles of the assemblies of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dmigs nas sngags bzlas bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dmigs nas sngags bzlas bar bya'o //
translated: Having visualized the Tathagatas, one should recite the mantra.

original: de nas gzhan ma yin par bstod pa'i dbyangs rnams rab tu gnas par @353a *//
analyzed: de nas gzhan ma yin par bstod pa'i dbyangs rnams rab tu gnas par @353a *//
translated: Then, one should recite the praises of the Tathagatas with a voice that is not different from the previous one.

original: 'gyur ro // de nas smon lam btab pa byas nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub grub pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mngon du phyogs pas phyag 'tshal te; ji srid skyo bar🔽ma gyur gyi bar du sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de nas smon lam btab pa byas nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub grub pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mngon du phyogs pas phyag 'tshal te; ji srid skyo bar ma gyur gyi bar du sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made the aspiration prayer, and having rejoiced in all the powers of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, such as the accomplishment of perfect awakening, and so forth, one should pay homage to all the tathāgatas, facing them, and recite the mantra as long as one does not become weary.

original: de nas rgya che ba'i tshul la 'jug pa'i mdo sde thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa sems la byas la sangs rgyas kyi snying po brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas rgya che ba'i tshul la 'jug pa'i mdo sde thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa sems la byas la sangs rgyas kyi snying po brjod cing /
translated: Then, having contemplated the introduction to all the sūtras of the vast way, one should recite the Buddha Essence,

original: lha la sogs pa kun nyon cig ces bya ba'i dam tshig brjod cing bsams la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa kun nyon cig ces bya ba'i dam tshig brjod cing bsams la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and having declared the pledge “Listen all, gods and so forth,” one should meditate while contemplating.

original: snga dro'i thun la de ltar byas nas zas za ba na stobs chen po dang / sman gyi rgyal po chen por byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: snga dro'i thun la de ltar byas nas zas za ba na stobs chen po dang / sman gyi rgyal po chen por byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Having done this in the morning session, when eating, one should recite the mantra of consecration as a great power and a great king of medicines.

original: na ma stree ya dhvi k'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma stree ya dhvi k'a n'am/

original: ta th'a ga t'a n'am/
analyzed: ta th'a ga t'a n'am/

analyzed: aom bhu dza li te sv'ah'a //

analyzed: de nas ngal sas la phyi nas glegs bam bklag pa la sogs pa byas te /
translated: Then, after resting, one should read scriptures, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du phyi dro'i thun la yang las rnams byas nas bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phyi dro'i thun la yang las rnams byas nas bzlas pa bya'o //

original: srod kyi dus su smon lam btab la yan lag thams cad btud pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas rtsva bting ba la dang por nyal la gnyid @353b log par bya'o //
analyzed: srod kyi dus su smon lam btab la yan lag thams cad btud pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas rtsva bting ba la dang por nyal la gnyid @353b log par bya'o //
translated: In the evening, having made aspirations and paid homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas with all limbs bowed down, one should first lie down on a spread of grass and go to sleep.

original: tshes gcig nas brtsams nas nyin re zhing zla ba gcig gi bar du las 'di ltar bya zhing nya'i nub mo dri'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam bzhag pa 'am /🔽sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
analyzed: tshes gcig nas brtsams nas nyin re zhing zla ba gcig gi bar du las 'di ltar bya zhing nya'i nub mo dri'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam bzhag pa 'am / sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
translated: Beginning on the first day, one should perform this rite every day for a month. On the evening of the last day, one should place the book of the holy Dharma on top of the fragrant maṇḍala,🔽or a stūpa containing relics,

original: bzhugs gnas kyi mchod rten nam /
analyzed: bzhugs gnas kyi mchod rten nam /
translated: or a stūpa at a holy site,

original: sku gzugs kyi mdun du 'am /
analyzed: sku gzugs kyi mdun du 'am /
translated: or in front of an image.

original: gzhan yang / dben par skyil mo krung bcas la skyil mo krung ma bshig par de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs nas bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dben par skyil mo krung bcas la skyil mo krung ma bshig par de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs nas bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: Moreover, in a secluded place, one should sit cross-legged, and without uncrossing one’s legs, one should recite the mantra while visualizing the Tathāgata.

original: ji srid 'od zer byung nas lus la phog gi bar du byas nas de nas lus 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid 'od zer byung nas lus la phog gi bar du byas nas de nas lus 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should do this until light rays emerge and touch one’s body, whereupon one’s body will blaze.

original: de'i rjes la lus 'di yongs su gyur nas rig 'dzin gyi rigs rnams nye bar lhags te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la lus 'di yongs su gyur nas rig 'dzin gyi rigs rnams nye bar lhags te /
translated: After that, one’s body will transform, and the families of knowledge-holders will gather.

original: de la dbang bskur bas bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rig 'dzin gyi rigs su gyur nas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dbang bskur bas bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rig 'dzin gyi rigs su gyur nas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the empowerment, in accordance with their merit, they become a type of knowledge-holder bodhisattva and attain their respective level.

analyzed: der yang shes rab dang / thabs dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par sbyor ba yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, they also attain the application of the perfections through the possession of wisdom and method.

original: rnam par rol pa sna tshogs pas rjes su 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rol pa sna tshogs pas rjes su 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They also engage in various kinds of play.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They make offerings to the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are never separated from the bodhisattva saṅgha.

original: thabs la mkhas pas 'dod pa las @354a *//
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas 'dod pa las @354a *//
translated: Through skill in means, they enjoy sense pleasures.

original: yongs su spyad kyang nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su spyad kyang nyams par mi 'gyur ro //

original: lus de nyid kyis sa non par 'gyur zhing bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rjes su spyod pa yang mthar gyis sogs shing so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus de nyid kyis sa non par 'gyur zhing bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rjes su spyod pa yang mthar gyis sogs shing so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that very body, he will tread the earth, and in the circle of the Tathāgata’s retinue, he will approach according to his merit, and gradually attain the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: gal te rig pa 'dzin pa thob par ma gyur na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te rig pa 'dzin pa thob par ma gyur na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ba 'am /
translated: If he does not attain the state of a knowledge-holder, he will see the body of the Tathāgata,

original: 'od kyis snang bar byas pa 'am /
analyzed: 'od kyis snang bar byas pa 'am /
translated: or he will be illuminated by its light,

original: gsung thos par 'gyur zhing de'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsung thos par 'gyur zhing de'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or he will hear its speech, and his intention will be purified.

original: gzungs kyang rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyang rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also attain the dhāraṇīs.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /

original: ri dang / chu klung dang / mtshe'u dang / chu gling dang / khang phug dang / gtsug lag khang gi gnas 'di lta bu dben pa rnams su sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /🔽sku gzugs sam /
analyzed: ri dang / chu klung dang / mtshe'u dang / chu gling dang / khang phug dang / gtsug lag khang gi gnas 'di lta bu dben pa rnams su sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam / sku gzugs sam /
translated: In such solitary places as mountains, rivers, ponds, islands, caves, and temples, in a stūpa with relics,🔽or in a statue,

original: ras ris la tha na /
analyzed: ras ris la tha na /

original: gtsug lag khang dben par 'du 'dzi spangs la dam pa'i chos la bla mar byed pas 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / ral gri la sogs pa'i khyad par rang gis blangs la mtshan rangs pa gcig skyil krung ma bshig pa 'am /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dben par 'du 'dzi spangs la dam pa'i chos la bla mar byed pas 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / ral gri la sogs pa'i khyad par rang gis blangs la mtshan rangs pa gcig skyil krung ma bshig pa 'am /
translated: In a secluded temple, having abandoned distractions, one should revere the holy Dharma. Having taken up a wheel, a vajra, a sword, or some other special object, one should sit cross-legged, or squatting on a spread of straw, until one becomes radiant.

original: tsog tsog por rtsva bting ba la nye bar 'dug la ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //🔽de bzhin @354b du ldong ros la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams dri'i dkyil 'khor ram /
analyzed: tsog tsog por rtsva bting ba la nye bar 'dug la ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o // de bzhin @354b du ldong ros la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams dri'i dkyil 'khor ram /
translated: One should recite the mantra until one becomes radiant.🔽In the same way, one should accomplish substances such as vermilion, having placed them in a mandala of perfume,

original: lo ma'i snod du bzhag nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: lo ma'i snod du bzhag nas bsgrub par bya'o //

original: 'di ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi rab tu mi dmigs pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi rab tu mi dmigs pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: This is the method of accomplishment of the bodhisattvas who are endowed with application and skillful means, who are utterly non-apprehending.

original: dben par mchod rten la sogs pa'i mdun du de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran pa la goms par byas nas ji srid mtshan ma byung gi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: dben par mchod rten la sogs pa'i mdun du de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran pa la goms par byas nas ji srid mtshan ma byung gi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Having become familiar with the recollection of the Tathāgatas in a secluded place in front of a stūpa or the like, one should recite the mantra until the signs arise.

original: zla ba nya ba la mtshan rangs skyil mo krung bcas nas bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba nya ba la mtshan rangs skyil mo krung bcas nas bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: On the night of the full moon, one should recite the mantra while sitting cross-legged.

original: gnyid spangs nas nyin zhag gcig tu de bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams yongs su bzung nas bsgrubs na phyir ldog pa med pa'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid spangs nas nyin zhag gcig tu de bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams yongs su bzung nas bsgrubs na phyir ldog pa med pa'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abandoning sleep, one should practice in this way for one day and one night, holding the substances such as the wheel, and so forth. One will become an irreversible vidyādhara.

original: 'di gzi brjid gang dang yang mnyam pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di gzi brjid gang dang yang mnyam pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become equal in splendor to any.

original: bsod nams dang mi ldan pas kyang tshe 'di nyid la nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽ras ris med kyang rung /
analyzed: bsod nams dang mi ldan pas kyang tshe 'di nyid la nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro // ras ris med kyang rung /
translated: Even one who is not meritorious will certainly be successful in this very life.🔽It is not necessary to have a painting.

original: mchod pa med kyang rung /
analyzed: mchod pa med kyang rung /
translated: It is not necessary to make offerings.

original: nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //

original: de nas ras ris bsgrub par 'dod na ras ris la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs ni padma la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ras ris bsgrub par 'dod na ras ris la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs ni padma la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: “Next, if one wishes to practice with a painting, the form of the Tathāgata in the painting should be seated on a lotus.

original: g-yas su ni 'phags pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas su ni 'phags pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: To the right is Noble Vajradhara,

original: g-yon du ni nam mkha'i spyan te /
analyzed: g-yon du ni nam mkha'i spyan te /
translated: and to the left is Ākāśa­garbha,

original: 'od zer sna tshogs nye bar 'phro ba thal mo sbyar nas 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer sna tshogs nye bar 'phro ba thal mo sbyar nas 'dug pa'o //
translated: radiating various light rays, standing with palms joined.

original: de dag la rdo rje 'dzin ni autpal sngon po'i mdog can no //
analyzed: de dag la rdo rje 'dzin ni autpal sngon po'i mdog can no //
translated: Vajradhara is blue like a blue lotus.

original: nam @355a *// mkha'i spyan ni sngo bsangs so //
analyzed: nam @355a *// mkha'i spyan ni sngo bsangs so //

original: sgrub pa po ni 'og tu lha mo la mngon du phyogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni 'og tu lha mo la mngon du phyogs par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner should face the goddess below.

original: ras ris 'di la yang cho ga snga ma nyid kyis zla ba nya'i bar du zla ba gcig gis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ras ris 'di la yang cho ga snga ma nyid kyis zla ba nya'i bar du zla ba gcig gis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In this painting, too, one should practice for one month up to the full moon with the previous rite.

original: aa pa ra tsi ta sngon bo'i sbyin sreg gis rgyal po dgug par bya ste /
analyzed: aa pa ra tsi ta sngon bo'i sbyin sreg gis rgyal po dgug par bya ste /
translated: One should summon the king with the blue apāmārga oblation.

original: rtog ba thams cad kyi cho gas sbyar na thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog ba thams cad kyi cho gas sbyar na thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When applied with the rite of all the rites, everything will be accomplished.

original: ras ris gnyis pa ni lha mo gcig pu gnas pa /
analyzed: ras ris gnyis pa ni lha mo gcig pu gnas pa /
translated: The second painting is of the goddess alone,

original: gser gyi mdog can /
analyzed: gser gyi mdog can /

original: zar ma'i me tog lta bu'i 'od 'bar ba /
analyzed: zar ma'i me tog lta bu'i 'od 'bar ba /
translated: radiating the light of jasmine flowers,

original: padma la rab tu gnas pa dang / ral pa dang bcas pa'i sgrub pa po bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma la rab tu gnas pa dang / ral pa dang bcas pa'i sgrub pa po bri bar bya'o //
translated: standing on a lotus, together with the practitioner with matted hair.

original: de dag la yang cho ga snga ma nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang cho ga snga ma nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: One should also do it with the previous rite.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i ral gri dang / ldong ros la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i ral gri dang / ldong ros la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya'o //

translated: all of that, and whatever exists in the realm of sentient beings, I dedicate to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas at all times.

original: yongs su bsngos nas bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis /
analyzed: yongs su bsngos nas bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis /
translated: Having dedicated, by the power of my merit and the blessing of the Tathagatas,

original: mchod pa'i sprin rab 'byams mchog tu rgya che ba /
analyzed: mchod pa'i sprin rab 'byams mchog tu rgya che ba /
translated: May these clouds of offerings, which are supreme, vast, and infinite,

original: chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod la /
translated: and which fill the entire realm of phenomena, arise in the maṇḍala of all tathāgatas.”

original: de lta bu'i mchod pa'i sprin 'byung bar byed pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di yang brjod pa bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mchod pa'i sprin 'byung bar byed pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di yang brjod pa bya ste /
translated: And one should recite this queen of knowledge mantras, which causes these clouds of offerings to arise:

original: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi sa tv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi sa tv'a n'am/
translated: Namo buddhāya, namo dharmāya, namaḥ saṅghāya.

original: sarba ta th'a ga te aa dhishthi te /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga te aa dhishthi te /

original: ga ga na kha bho spha ra sa mante na sv'ah'a /
analyzed: ga ga na kha bho spha ra sa mante na sv'ah'a /

original: zhes @361a *// lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes @361a *// lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this up to eight times.

original: lhag ma yang ji ltar tsam 'dod pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma yang ji ltar tsam 'dod pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the rest should be recited as much as one wishes.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mchod pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par gnas par 'gyur zhing byin gyis rlob la mkhyen par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mchod pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par gnas par 'gyur zhing byin gyis rlob la mkhyen par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Then all the buddhas and bodhisattvas will truly abide, bless, and know the offerings.

original: de nas bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs kyi sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yon tan bsngags pa'i rgya mtsho glu dbyangs mchog rgya che ba rab 'byams rnams de bzhin gshegs par thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod la /
analyzed: de nas bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs kyi sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yon tan bsngags pa'i rgya mtsho glu dbyangs mchog rgya che ba rab 'byams rnams de bzhin gshegs par thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod la /
translated: Then, with the power of my merit, may the ocean of the supreme songs of praise to the qualities of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas arise through the blessing of all the tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yon tan bsngags pa dang / chos sgrogs pa'i dbyangs 'byung bar byed pa'i rig pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yon tan bsngags pa dang / chos sgrogs pa'i dbyangs 'byung bar byed pa'i rig pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the queen of knowledge mantras that produces the sound of praising the qualities of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas and proclaiming the Dharma up to eight times.

original: na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi sa tv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi sa tv'a n'am/

original: sarba tra sam ku su mi ta aa bhi dzny'a ta r'a shi ni /
analyzed: sarba tra sam ku su mi ta aa bhi dzny'a ta r'a shi ni /

original: na mo stu ste sv'ah'a /
analyzed: na mo stu ste sv'ah'a /

original: de ltar don yod pa 'di la mngon par dad par byas nas bsgrubs na de bzhin du 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar don yod pa 'di la mngon par dad par byas nas bsgrubs na de bzhin du 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has faith in this unfailing [mantra] and practices it, it will arise just as it is.

original: de nas bla na med pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs de dag thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o; ;de nas tshad med pa'i sems bskyed pa gang yang rung ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas sems bskyed la sngags bzlas shing /
analyzed: de nas bla na med pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs de dag thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o; ;de nas tshad med pa'i sems bskyed pa gang yang rung ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas sems bskyed la sngags bzlas shing /
translated: Then, with the generation of an immeasurable mind and with a superior intention, one should generate the mind and recite the mantra.

original: de ltar re zhig bdag gis sems bskyed pa dang pos @361b bdag gi smon lam dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'dir sems can gyi khams thams cad sems bskyed pa grub par gyur cig /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bdag gis sems bskyed pa dang pos @361b bdag gi smon lam dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'dir sems can gyi khams thams cad sems bskyed pa grub par gyur cig /
translated: “In this way, by the power of my prayers, merit, and wisdom, may all the realms of sentient beings be established in the generation of the mind through the first generation of the mind by me.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyang 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyang 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya'o //
translated: May the blessings of the Tathāgatas also arise.”

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa grub par gyur cig /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa grub par gyur cig /
translated: Or one should say, “May the Bodhicaryāvatāra be accomplished.

original: 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod do //

original: yang na bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs rgya mtsho sems can thams cad la 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: yang na bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs rgya mtsho sems can thams cad la 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba'am /
translated: Or else, “May the ocean of the accumulation of unsurpassed wisdom arise for all sentient beings.”

original: yang na dngos grub gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen pa de bdag gi bsod nams dang; ye shes kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can thams cad kyi dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur cig ces bsams la /
analyzed: yang na dngos grub gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen pa de bdag gi bsod nams dang; ye shes kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can thams cad kyi dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur cig ces bsams la /
translated: Or else, “May the power of my merit and wisdom and the blessings of the Tathāgatas cause the attainment of whatever siddhi is known by the Blessed Buddhas to arise for all sentient beings.”

original: sngags kyi rgyal po lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //🔽na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o // na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: One should think this and recite the king of mantras up to eight times.🔽namas sarva buddhānāṃ bodhisatvā nāṃ

original: na mo stu ste mah'a badzra sarba st'a hi tam ka ra tishtha sarba tra sarba sha ta dharma n'am dhishtha ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: na mo stu ste mah'a badzra sarba st'a hi tam ka ra tishtha sarba tra sarba sha ta dharma n'am dhishtha ya sv'ah'a /
translated: namaḥ stu te mahāvajra sarvasatva hitakara tiṣṭha sarvatra sarvaśata dharmanāṃ adhiṣṭhāya svāhā.

original: de'i rjes la 'dir sems can gyi khams rnams la ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du sems can rnams la phan pa'i rnam pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'dir sems can gyi khams rnams la ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du sems can rnams la phan pa'i rnam pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, here, in the realms of sentient beings, all the forms of benefit for sentient beings arise just as one wishes.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dmigs shing phyag byas la /🔽sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar dmigs nas ji srid skyo @362a *//
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dmigs shing phyag byas la / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar dmigs nas ji srid skyo @362a *//
translated: Then, having visualized and made prostrations to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: bar ma gyur gyi bar du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma gyur gyi bar du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: and having visualized rejoicing in all the powers of the perfect enlightenment of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, one should recite [the mantra] as long as one does not become weary.

original: de nas glegs bam bklags la zas la spyad cing zas kyis dub na bstis nas snga dro'i cho ga de nyid kyis phyi dro yang bya'o //
analyzed: de nas glegs bam bklags la zas la spyad cing zas kyis dub na bstis nas snga dro'i cho ga de nyid kyis phyi dro yang bya'o //
translated: Then, having read the scriptures, having eaten food, and having rested when tired by eating, one should do [the practice] in the evening with the very same morning rite.

original: nyal ba na dang po yan lag thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas khri ma yin pa la nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyal ba na dang po yan lag thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas khri ma yin pa la nyal bar bya'o //
translated: When going to sleep, first of all, with all limbs, pay homage to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and then go to sleep on the right side in the lion's posture.

original: cho ga 'di nyid kyis nus pa ji lta ba dang / stobs ji lta ba bzhin nyin re zhing yar ngo'i nya'i zla ba gcig gi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di nyid kyis nus pa ji lta ba dang / stobs ji lta ba bzhin nyin re zhing yar ngo'i nya'i zla ba gcig gi bar du bya'o //
translated: With this very rite, as much as possible and as much as one is able, one should practice for a month of the waxing moon.

original: de nas thabs dang mi ldan pa'i cho ga yang ji skad gsungs pa bzhin nus pa ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub par bya yi /🔽dag gis nus pa ma yin no /
analyzed: de nas thabs dang mi ldan pa'i cho ga yang ji skad gsungs pa bzhin nus pa ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub par bya yi / dag gis nus pa ma yin no /
translated: Then, with regard to the rite that is not endowed with means, one should practice as much as one is able, just as it is taught.

original: zhes sgyid lug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes sgyid lug par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not be discouraged, thinking, I am not able.

original: las ji lta ba 'bras bu yang de lta bu'i zhes bya bas dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bsams la ri la sogs pa'i gnas rab tu dben pa'am /
analyzed: las ji lta ba 'bras bu yang de lta bu'i zhes bya bas dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro // zhes bsams la ri la sogs pa'i gnas rab tu dben pa'am /
translated: The result is just like the action.

original: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i khang pa stong pa'am /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i khang pa stong pa'am /
translated: Thinking thus, in a very secluded place such as a mountain, or in an empty house such as a temple,🔽one should practice the rite that is endowed with means.

original: bla gab med par 'du 'dzin rnam par spangs la sems can la gnod pa med pas cho ga 'di bzhin du bya'o; ;khrus la sogs pa med kyang rung /
analyzed: bla gab med par 'du 'dzin rnam par spangs la sems can la gnod pa med pas cho ga 'di bzhin du bya'o; ;khrus la sogs pa med kyang rung /
translated: It is also suitable to do without bathing and so on,

original: ras ris med kyang rung /
analyzed: ras ris med kyang rung /

original: chul khrims 'tshal pa yin yang rung /🔽dman pa yin yang rung /
analyzed: chul khrims 'tshal pa yin yang rung / dman pa yin yang rung /
translated: without observing the rules,🔽without being a novice,

original: bsod nams dang mi ldan yang rung ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang mi ldan yang rung ste /

original: gang yang mang du sgrub pa la goms par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang mang du sgrub pa la goms par bya'o //
translated: One should practice this rite a great deal.

original: mun pa chen po nas snang bar 'jug par 'dod pa dang / 'khor par ltung ba rnams byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la bskyon par 'dod pa dang / gang yang @362b mang du 'bad bas log par ltung ba rnams rab tu gzung zhing snang bar byed pa rab tu thob par 'dod pas cho ga bzhin nyin re zhing zla ba gcig gi bar du byas la /
analyzed: mun pa chen po nas snang bar 'jug par 'dod pa dang / 'khor par ltung ba rnams byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la bskyon par 'dod pa dang / gang yang @362b mang du 'bad bas log par ltung ba rnams rab tu gzung zhing snang bar byed pa rab tu thob par 'dod pas cho ga bzhin nyin re zhing zla ba gcig gi bar du byas la /
translated: Those who wish to enter the light from the great darkness, those who wish to place those who have fallen into saṃsāra upon the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, and those who wish to attain the light that is the protection and support of those who have fallen into error through great effort—all of them should perform this rite every day for a month, in accordance with the rite.

original: mthar yar ngo'i bco lnga la ji ltar mngon par 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / ras ris dang / dam pa'i chos glegs bam mam /
analyzed: mthar yar ngo'i bco lnga la ji ltar mngon par 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / ras ris dang / dam pa'i chos glegs bam mam /
translated: Finally, on the fifteenth day of the waxing phase, one should make offerings to the best of one’s ability and, in front of a stūpa, an image, a painting, or a book of the sublime Dharma,

original: gang yang rung ba'i mdun du me tog sil mas bkram pa'i dkyil 'khor byas la /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i mdun du me tog sil mas bkram pa'i dkyil 'khor byas la /
translated: one should prepare a maṇḍala strewn with loose flowers.

original: lo ma bting ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: lo ma bting ba la 'dug ste /
translated: One should sit on a spread of kuśa grass

original: bsrung ba'i cho ga la sogs pa snga ma bzhin bsams la lan gsum gyi bar du sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i cho ga la sogs pa snga ma bzhin bsams la lan gsum gyi bar du sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: and, having visualized the protection circle and so forth as before, one should recite the mantra three times.

original: de nas lcags kyi 'khor lo 'am; rdo rje'am /
analyzed: de nas lcags kyi 'khor lo 'am; rdo rje'am /
translated: Then, one should take an iron wheel, a vajra,

original: ral gri 'am /
analyzed: ral gri 'am /

original: mdung ngam / lcags kyu 'am /
analyzed: mdung ngam / lcags kyu 'am /

original: chu gri zla phyed kyi bar du ba lang gi lci ba'i nang du bcug nas bton la /
analyzed: chu gri zla phyed kyi bar du ba lang gi lci ba'i nang du bcug nas bton la /
translated: or a knife, and insert it into cow dung up to the hilt.

original: lag tu bzung nas srod dang po nas brtsams nas mtshan rangs par sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: lag tu bzung nas srod dang po nas brtsams nas mtshan rangs par sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Holding it in one’s hand, one should perform the rite from dusk until dawn, having paid homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: yang na rdo rje las byas ba ra'i 'o ma'i nang du bcug pas so //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje las byas ba ra'i 'o ma'i nang du bcug pas so //
translated: Or else, it is made of diamond, and placed in the milk of a wild cow.

original: yang na dngul dang / zangs dang / gser las byas pa zla ba phyed du chu'i nang du bcug pa'am /
analyzed: yang na dngul dang / zangs dang / gser las byas pa zla ba phyed du chu'i nang du bcug pa'am /
translated: Or else, it is made of silver, copper, or gold, and placed in water for half a month.

original: mig sman pa'i 'o ma'i bum par gcug pa'am /🔽bsegs ba'am / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / gi wang ngam /
analyzed: mig sman pa'i 'o ma'i bum par gcug pa'am / bsegs ba'am / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / gi wang ngam /
translated: Or else, it is placed in a pot of the milk of a white cow.🔽Or else, it is made of orpiment, realgar, or gannister.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa lo ma'am /🔽gos kyi bar du lag tu bzung la bsgrub bar bya'o //🔽yang na nor bu 'am /🔽yang na phreng ba'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa lo ma'am / gos kyi bar du lag tu bzung la bsgrub bar bya'o // yang na nor bu 'am / yang na phreng ba'am /
translated: Or else, it is made of a naturally growing leaf.🔽Or else, it is made of cloth.🔽Or else, it is made of a gem.

original: yang na lhung bzed bkrus pa'am /🔽gos sam / gnas sam /
analyzed: yang na lhung bzed bkrus pa'am / gos sam / gnas sam /
translated: Or else, it is made of a rosary.🔽Or else, it is made of a washed begging-bowl.🔽Or else, it is made of cloth, a dwelling,

original: gdugs sam / ri mo lag tu bzung bas sam /
analyzed: gdugs sam / ri mo lag tu bzung bas sam /
